Def.Name: Pussy Willow
Def.Description: Shrub or small tree growing to 20' tall. May have multiple stems or a single trunk.
Def.Leaves: Alternate, 1 3/16" - 5 1/2" long and 3/8" - 1 3/8" wide. Irregularl tooth margins, glossy green on top; whitish below (no hairs). May have pair of large stipules up to 1/4" long and wide.
Def.Twigs: Red-brown, smooth. May have orange lenticels (dots). Actively growing twigs may be green with some hairs.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule, with multiple seeds (female). Male catkins open with dense gray hair.
Def.Bark: Gray-brown at base, rought and fissured. Younger bark is red-brown and smooth.
Def.Range: Canada, and the northern portions of the contiguous United States.
Def.Remarks: Often grown for use in cut flowers. Bees and flies can be seen around Pussy Willows.
